title: Remember the Year
description: Can you remember which year these famous events happened? Put your long-term memory to the test with iconic moments from history!

questions.question: In what year did Neil Armstrong first walk on the Moon?
questions.explanation: Neil Armstrong took his famous 'one small step' on July 20, 1969, during the Apollo 11 mission. An estimated 600 million people watched the event on television.

questions.question: In what year did Elvis Presley first appear on The Ed Sullivan Show?
questions.explanation: Elvis Presley made his legendary Ed Sullivan Show debut on September 9, 1956. The show drew about 60 million viewers — a record at the time — and helped launch him to superstardom.

questions.question: In what year did the Berlin Wall come down?
questions.explanation: The Berlin Wall fell on November 9, 1989, after 28 years of dividing East and West Berlin. Jubilant crowds celebrated and chipped away at the wall with hammers and pickaxes.

questions.question: In what year did President John F. Kennedy get assassinated?
questions.explanation: President Kennedy was assassinated in Dallas, Texas, on November 22, 1963. It was a defining moment for a generation — most people alive at the time remember exactly where they were when they heard the news.

questions.question: In what year did the Woodstock Music Festival take place?
questions.explanation: Woodstock was held August 15–18, 1969, on a dairy farm in Bethel, New York. Over 400,000 people attended the festival, which featured Jimi Hendrix, Janis Joplin, and many other legendary artists.

questions.question: In what year did the Titanic sink on its maiden voyage?
questions.explanation: The RMS Titanic struck an iceberg and sank on April 15, 1912, during its maiden voyage from Southampton to New York. Over 1,500 of the approximately 2,200 passengers and crew perished.

questions.question: In what year did Martin Luther King Jr. deliver his 'I Have a Dream' speech?
questions.explanation: Dr. King delivered his iconic speech on August 28, 1963, from the steps of the Lincoln Memorial during the March on Washington. An estimated 250,000 people gathered to hear him.

questions.question: In what year did The Beatles first appear on The Ed Sullivan Show in America?
questions.explanation: The Beatles made their historic American TV debut on The Ed Sullivan Show on February 9, 1964. About 73 million viewers tuned in — the largest American TV audience at the time — launching 'Beatlemania' in the U.S.

questions.question: In what year did World War II end?
questions.explanation: World War II ended in 1945. Germany surrendered on May 8 (V-E Day), and Japan surrendered on August 15 (V-J Day) following the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

questions.question: In what year did Disneyland open in Anaheim, California?
questions.explanation: Disneyland opened on July 17, 1955, with Walt Disney himself hosting a live television special for the grand opening. It was the first major theme park of its kind.

questions.question: In what year did the Space Shuttle Challenger disaster occur?
questions.explanation: The Space Shuttle Challenger broke apart 73 seconds after launch on January 28, 1986, tragically killing all seven crew members, including teacher Christa McAuliffe. Many schoolchildren watched the launch live on TV.

questions.question: In what year did Princess Diana and Prince Charles get married?
questions.explanation: The 'wedding of the century' took place on July 29, 1981, at St Paul's Cathedral in London. An estimated 750 million people worldwide watched the ceremony on television.

questions.question: In what year did the first color broadcast of the World Series take place?
questions.explanation: The 1953 World Series between the New York Yankees and Brooklyn Dodgers was the first to be broadcast in color on NBC, though very few households had color TVs at the time.

questions.question: In what year did Rosa Parks refuse to give up her bus seat in Montgomery, Alabama?
questions.explanation: Rosa Parks was arrested on December 1, 1955, for refusing to give up her seat to a white passenger. Her courageous act sparked the Montgomery Bus Boycott and became a defining moment of the Civil Rights Movement.

questions.question: In what year did 'I Love Lucy' first premiere on television?
questions.explanation: I Love Lucy premiered on CBS on October 15, 1951, starring Lucille Ball and Desi Arnaz. It became one of the most beloved and watched shows in TV history, with over 60 million viewers tuning in for some episodes.
